p: In general, the repellant percentage in S. oryzae adult stage increased with increasing the concentrations of three studied EOs and increasing exposure times. Regarding O. basilicum EOs results in Figure 4, the highest significant repellency of S. oryzae was recorded as 82.3% for 0.75 mg/cm 2 at 5 h compared to control (4 ppm malathion) at 5 h with the value of 93.2%, followed by 78.3 and 69.7% for 0.75 mg/cm 2 at 4 and 3 h, respectively, while the lowest significant repellency value was 54.2% at 0.25 mg/cm 2 O. basilicum after 1 h.
